bug.author: tobycheese
bug.summary: DataFrame with mixed type index results in error
bug.description:
Describe the bug A dataframe with an index of type object that actually has index values of different python datatypes (int and str) results in an error To Reproduce """ Test for issue XXX: https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/XXX """ import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling
def test_issueXXX(): try: pd.DataFrame(data=[[1],[2]], index=['foo', 1], columns=['a']).profile_report() except AttributeError: self.fail('AttributeError raised when profiling df with mixed-type index') Version information: Version information is essential in reproducing and resolving bugs. Please report:
Python version: Python 3.7.4 Environment: any pip: I am skipping this as the bug is obvious.

comments.comment: Oh and the same error happens when a column has mixed datatypes: I used df.reset_index() to move by index to a column to work around the issue, but got the same error. I know I should fix my datatypes, and I don't really think this needs fixing in profile_report(), but if it gave a nice warning instead of failing, that would be helpful. It took me a moment to find the cause of the error.
Thank you for reporting this, should be fixed in the next version.
